alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:33AM CDT until October 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut Creek near Mansfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Major flooding will occur along the creek through Mansfield, downstream of Joe Pool Lake. At 25 feet, several houses near the creek begin to flood. Oliver Nature Park and Town Park are also flooded. Retta Road, North Street, Walnut Creek Road, and Magnolia Road are flooded with several feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 21.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 10.5 feet late tonight. It will rise to 11.0 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
